metadata.name: Application Using Device Code Authentication Flow
metadata.comment: Device code flow is an OAuth 2.0 protocol flow specifically for input constrained devices and is not used in all environments. If this type of flow is seen in the environment and not being used in an input constrained device scenario, further investigation is warranted. This can be a misconfigured application or potentially something malicious.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM account_change WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(message) = lower('device code'))

output.summary: Device code flow is an OAuth 2.0 protocol flow specifically for input constrained devices and is not used in all environments. metadata.objective: False positive: Applications that are input constrained will need to use device code flow and are valid authentications. Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/architecture/security-operations-applications#application-authentication-flows
